result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J Messier

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jesse J Messier not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Notice recipient Cayli R Peterson in court with Atty. John Dade. Matter before the Court on Ms. Peterson's request to have bond money refunded to her. State does not take a position - warrant has already been issued for the defendant who failed to appear in court. Court grants the motion and will refund the cash posted by Ms. Peterson. Court in recess.
pro se letter to the court regarding bond and ineffective counsel
Motion hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Request from Person posting bond

Defendant Jesse J Messier not in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Jesse J Messier.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to withdraw as counsel of record by Attorney Lochowicz. Courts Grants motion. Attorney Lochowicz to prepare order. Warrant remains. Minutes filed.

Defendant Jesse J Messier not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA Sempf.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Jesse J Messier. Called @ 2:24 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for bail forfeiture hearing. Record by Atty. Lochowicz that he has lost all contact with the defendant and would like matter set on his motion to withdraw.

Court enters judgment on bail bond forfeiture and sets matter for motion to withdraw as counsel.

Warrant remains.
Motion hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jesse J Messier not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA JJ Crawford.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Jesse J Messier. Called @ 3:27 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 3rd and final status conference. Record by Atty. Lochowicz that he has no explanation for non-appearance of defendant. Response by the State who asks for warrant and bail bond forfeiture. Court grants the request. Warrant to issue and bond forfeited.

Defendant Jesse J Messier not in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Jesse J Messier.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:34 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for 3rd and final status. Record by Atty. Lcohowicz as to non-appearance of defendant due to family emergency. Requests that matter be set out a couple weeks for defendant to appear. Court grants request, but defendant must appear at next hearing. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Called at 1:38 PM. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse J Messier in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Jesse J Messier. Record by attorney as to motion to modify bond. Response by the court. Objection by the State - record by Attorney TenHaken. Response by Attorney Lochowicz. Motion denied. Bond remains. Minutes filed. Future dates remain as scheduled.
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jesse J Messier appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz for Jesse J Messier appeared in court, Attorney Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Called @ 3:05 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 2nd status/potential plea. Record by Atty. Lochowicz as to status of resolution, and asks for one final status. If matter not resolved, he will be asking for trial dates at next hearing. Court grants request. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Invocation of Right to Counsel

Defendant Jesse J Messier appeared in court, in custody by video, Attorney Keith Venema for Bradley J. Lochowicz appeared in court for Jesse J Messier, Attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 4:01 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status hearing. Record by Atty. Venema as to ongoing negotiations and new offer from the State. Asks for one additional status that is potential plea. Court grants. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Authorization to Appear and Act
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: with Exhibit #1 attached.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

02:04 PM (64-06) Defendant Jesse J Messier in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz.  Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jesse J Messier appeared by video means.
The State called to the stand as a witness Deputy Samuel Barrett.
Samuel Barrett duly sworn and testified on direct examination of ADA Berg. Witness identified the defendant in court.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
2:22 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Lochowicz.
Evidence is closed.
2:32 PM - Argument by the State.
2:32 PM - Argument by attorney Lochowicz.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges.
Arraignment held in open court.
Attorney Lochowicz acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charged on behalf of his client.

Adj. 2:35 PM

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Bradley Lochowicz

Defendant Jesse J Messier in court, in custody via video with attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance, complaint reading waived, charges/penalties explained.  Preliminary hearing rights given & hearing requested within time period.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.
Notice of Arrest

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH N.W.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-230 thru 22-236

Defendant Jesse J Messier in court in custody via video with attorney Tony Kim.  Samuel Berg for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify for SPD.  Defendant on PO hold & has Jefferson Co warrant.  Minutes filed.
